    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ChatDatabase getInstance​(android.content.Context ignored)
        Get an instance of the ChatDatabase for search, retrieval and archive of chat messages.
        Parameters:
        ignored - no longer used.
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of the ChatDatabase.

      • addChat

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> addChat​(android.os.Bundle chatMessage)
        Ability to take a correctly formatted Chat Bundle and add it to the ChatDatabase.
        Parameters:
        chatMessage - a bundle created from ChatMessage.toBundle() or a bundle containing the following keys - "conversationName", "conversationId", "messageId", "senderUid", "senderCallsign", "parent", "paths", "deleteChild", "groupOwner", "message", status
        Returns:
        a list of longs, but effectively a single row based on the Chat Message bundle.

      • addGroup

        public void addGroup​(GroupContact gc,
                     boolean local)

      • removeGroup

        public void removeGroup​(java.lang.String conversationId)
        Removes the conversation from the device. If this is a group, the persisted group id is removed and the conversation. If this is just a conversation, then the conversation is removed
        Parameters:
        conversationId - the conversation id

      • getHistory

        public java.util.List<android.os.Bundle> getHistory​(java.lang.String conversationId)
        Returns the history of a given conversation as a list of bundles.
        Parameters:
        conversationId - the chat conversation identification
        Returns:
        return an array of bundles that represent each line in the chat history where the bundle is a representation of the cursor return.

      • getHistory

        public java.util.List<android.os.Bundle> getHistory​(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                                    int limit,
                                                    boolean legacy)
        Returns the history of a given conversation as a list of bundles.
        Parameters:
        conversationId - the chat conversation identification
        limit - limit the conversation return to the last n conversations or -1 for all conversations.
        legacy - toast an error message which is legacy behavior
        Returns:
        return an array of bundles that represent each line in the chat history where the bundle is a representation of the cursor return or an empty array if there are conversations. Note the return can be less than the limit.

      • getPersistedConversationIds

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPersistedConversationIds()
        Returns a list of the persisted conversation identifiers.
        Returns:
        the conversation identifiers for the system that have been persisted.

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getGroupInfo​(java.lang.String conversationId)
        Returns the group information for a specific conversation identifier.
        Parameters:
        conversationId - the conversationId
        Returns:
        the group information in list form.

      • getAvailableConversations

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAvailableConversations()
        Obtain the list of conversation identifiers.
        Returns:
        the list of string identifiers.

      • getMessage

        public android.os.Bundle getMessage​(long id,
                                    java.lang.String table)
        Given an id and a table, return the bundle for a specific message.
        Parameters:
        id - the given message id
        table - the table to pull from
        Returns:
        the bundle that represents the message.

      • getChatMessageFromEventUID

        public android.os.Bundle getChatMessageFromEventUID​(java.lang.String eventUID)
        Given a specific cot event uid, retrieve the chat message associated.
        Parameters:
        eventUID - the cot event uid the message
        Returns:
        the bundle that represents the chat message.

      • removeChatMessage

        public boolean removeChatMessage​(java.lang.String messageId)
        The ability to remove a chat message from the database given a message identifier.
        Parameters:
        messageId - the message identifier.
        Returns:
        true if the deletion was successful, false if the deletion failed.

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile​(java.lang.String filename,
                               java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> resultTable)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Given a results table, write the values to a file.
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename to write to
        resultTable - the results table
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - error if the write failed.
